page.title: 01DESCRIPTION:DANE END & AREA
page.content: The area consists of two villages, {DANE END and SACOMBE}and the three hamlets of{SACOMBE GREEN, ROWNEY {PRIORY and POTTERS GREEN. } The area, in{North East Hertfordshire is quiet and peaceful. It is good farming country, mainly arable. The highest point in the D-block is 125m above sea level. There are two churches, All Saints at Little Munden, near Dane End and St. Catherine's at Sacombe. There is a combined general store and Post Office, a garage which used to be the blacksmiths and one public house called "The Boot". These are all in Dane End. One primary school serves the area. This is Little Munden JMI School which is situated next to All Saints Church. Roads often become impassable because of drifting snow and flood water.
